verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. Maschil of the sons of Korah. As the hart<WH354> panteth<WH6165> after the water<WH4325> brooks<WH650>, So panteth<WH6165> my soul<WH5315> after thee<WH430>, O God.
My soul<WH5315> thirsteth<WH6770> for God<WH430>, for the living<WH2416> God<WH410>: When shall I come<WH935> and appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> God<WH430>?
My tears<WH1832> have been my food<WH3899> day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>, While they continually<WH3117> say<WH559> unto me<WH430>, Where is thy God?

These things I remember<WH2142>, and pour out<WH8210> my soul<WH5315> within me<WH5674>, How I went with the throng<WH5519>, and led<WH1718> them to the house<WH1004> of God<WH430>, With the voice<WH6963> of joy<WH7440> and praise<WH8426>, a multitude<WH1995> keeping holyday<WH2287>.

Why art thou cast down<WH7817>, O my soul<WH5315>? And why art thou disquieted<WH1993> within me<WH3176>? Hope thou in God<WH430>; for I shall yet praise<WH3034> him For the help<WH3444> of his countenance<WH6440>.

O my God<WH430>, my soul<WH5315> is cast down<WH7817> within me<WH2142>: Therefore do I remember thee from the land<WH776> of the Jordan<WH3383>, And the Hermons<WH2769>, from the hill<WH2022> Mizar<WH4706>.
Deep <WH8415> calleth<WH7121> unto deep<WH8415> at the noise<WH6963> of thy waterfalls<WH6794>: All thy waves<WH4867> and thy billows<WH1530> are gone over me<WH5674>.

Yet Jehovah<WH3068> will command<WH6680> his lovingkindness<WH2617> in the day-time<WH3119>; And in the night<WH3915> his song<WH7892> shall be with me<WH8605>, Even a prayer unto the God<WH410> of my life<WH2416>.
I will say<WH559> unto God<WH410> my rock<WH5553>, Why hast thou forgotten<WH7911> me<WH3212>? Why go I mourning<WH6937> because of the oppression<WH3906> of the enemy<WH341>?
As with a sword<WH7524> in my bones<WH6106>, mine adversaries<WH6887> reproach<WH2778> me<WH3117>, While they continually say<WH559> unto me<WH430>, Where is thy God?

Why art thou cast down<WH7817>, O my soul<WH5315>? And why art thou disquieted<WH1993> within me<WH3176>? Hope thou in God<WH430>; For I shall yet praise<WH3034> him<WH3444>, Who is the help of my countenance<WH6440>, and my God<WH430>.
